body: Could you share a recording of this in action? Also are you on X11 or Wayland?
Is this a regression? If so, can you bisect it?
Also could you please not use asciinema to report a terminal bug? It's rather useless for this.

@chrisduerr - Can you recommend a better recorder that works on Wayland? It's very easy to reproduce this bug so I'm not sure it's worth much effort getting a good recording tbh ;) I'm happy to bisect but won't be able to do this for a few days. But yes, it's a regression afaik.

I can't recommend anything on Wayland. But obviously something that actually records the screen is required to give a useful display of what's actually going on.

If this happens on Wayland, that's likely the reason why I cannot reproduce it. A bisect in that case would probably be more useful than a recording.
I'd assume the issue is due to Wayland DoS protection and likely comes from https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/cbcc12944006603131119b73c2ad72ebccf4562d.
@chrisduerr - confirmed - that top commit cbcc129 is the problem.

issue.title: Fix selection flooding Wayland connection
issue.body:
This resolves an issue where an excessive clipboard update frequency
would cause the Wayland display server to ignore necessary selection
updates.

Instead of copying the selection to the clipboard during the selection
process, it is now only copied once the mouse button is released.

Fixes #4953

body: @jamesodhunt Could you verify that #4979 solves your issue?
Hi @chrisduerr - yep, works for me! Thanks.
